content:
The provided chunk is part of a Python class's documentation string (docstring), specifically explaining the structure and usage of state names within a finite state machine model. The docstring details how each entry in a list corresponds to specific states, represented by numbers 0 through 4, and provides a diagram illustrating the state transitions and relationships. This context is crucial for understanding how the class initializes and manages its state configurations.

Context: The chunk is located within the class's docstring, detailing the structure of state name mappings and their corresponding visual representation in the form of a state transition diagram.

Each list must have five entries.

        .. rubric:: More Details

        Here is a diagram showing the where the names from the list
        are used::

            +---------+
            | 0 (off) |----> (any other state and vice versa).
            +---------+

                       +--------+
                    -->| 4 (on) |---
                   |   +--------+   |
                   |                |
                   |                v
             +---------+       +---------+
             | 3 (off) |<----->| 1 (off) |
             +---------+       +---------+
                   ^                |
                   |                |
                   |  +---------+   |
                    --| 2 (off) |<--
                      +---------+
